title: The Apprentice star Claude Littner undergoes back surgery
text:
Claude Littner is having surgery on his back (Picture: ITV/REX)

The Apprentice star Claude Littner is undergoing back surgery.

The 70-year-old is set to have an operation on his back on Wednesday, but said he hoped to be back live-tweeting this series of The Apprentice as soon as possible.

Lord Sugar sent his best wishes to his co-star on Twitter, saying: ‘Good luck to @claudelittner with his back operation tomorrow.’

Claude’s followers also sent messages of support wishing him a speedy recovery.

He tweeted back to the businessman: ‘Thank you Alan. Hope you are making good progress from your knee replacement surgery.’

One fan messaged Claude: ‘Good luck for tomorrow…. Hoping you will still be able to tweet while recovering or the program will not be the same!’

‘Do my best!’ he replied.

Another viewer posed: ‘Good luck on your operation and a speedy recovery. Hope you get to see the broadcast of tomorrows episode of the apprentice even though I will be on the catch up unless by a miracle I get home in time :-).’

Claude tweeted back: ‘Try for a miracle!’

The tough-talking businessman has been part of the show since 2015, replacing Lord Sugar’s former aide Nick Hewer. Along with Karren Brady, he oversees the contestants during their tasks on each episode, dishing out no nonsense feedback in the boardroom.

He previously said that he finds this year’s current crop of contestants ‘incredibly irritating’.

Probably all the years of those uncomfortable boardroom chairs taking their toll (Picture: PA)

‘Normally, I’m completely dispassionate. I watch the candidates day in day out and I don’t really care,’ Claude told Metro.co.uk at an exclusive press screening.

‘However, this year I found them incredibly irritating and as you go through, you’ll find them irritating as well, I guarantee it.’

The Apprentice airs Wednesdays at 9pm on BBC One.
